generate_guidance.guidance: Design double-shelled structures with Fe incorporation to enhance OER activity, conductivity, and stability.
Anchor Fe-based molecular catalysts to substrates to achieve superior ORR activity surpassing Pt/C.
Implement dual decoration of Fe centers with sulfur atoms and nanoclusters to break symmetric electronic interfaces and improve OH* desorption kinetics.
Optimize Fe-N coordination moieties in FeNC catalysts to achieve high half-wave potentials (>0.89 V) and power densities in energy devices.
Prioritize Fe single-atom configurations over metallocorrole structures when high ORR activity is required, as Fe shows moderate performance compared to Co/Cu centers.
Enhance durability by controlling Fe atomic dissolution through optimized coordination environments and surface oxidation states.
Leverage Fe-Co oxide hybrid structures to combine the benefits of bimetallic synergy and improved active site exposure.
Avoid excessive Fe particle aggregation by balancing nanocluster formation with single-atom dispersion for synergistic ORR enhancement.
